rComments: Horrible. I regret taking this class.

Professor is very direct and helpful when approached respectfully. She has a difficult time communicating with students in class and office hours, though not for lack of effort. Requires a lot of patience to learn from, but if you're very interested in the subject it is worth the effort. Otherwise avoid because of focus on definitions, not concepts

Professor Poole is clear, straightforward, and knows what she is talking about. If you attend lecture and take notes, you will have no problem in the class. The only students who seemed to struggle were those who thought they could blow off the class and still receive an A. She was very helpful during office hours and overall, I learned a lot.

She is a great professor who tries really hard. She speaks and communicates directly to students which I think bothers some people for some reason. Go to her office hours early on and talk to her a bit, that's what I did and I always liked her. Class is just readings, a paper, a short power-point you give and an easy final.

I think that she is just very straight forward, which I think makes sense given she is an Econ professor. I noticed students mis-interpreting her directness as "scorn" or whatever. She is very clear and communicates very effectively. The problem is the young students who are not used to correct communication. Tests were fair.

This woman is not approachable. Why is she still on the UCSC staff? I have no idea. If you plan on working extremely hard you still won't receive an A. A few word's of advice DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. This is not a GPA booster. Take Econ126 instead. This woman is not worth your time or money. She should be fired already.

She is extremely rude to students and doesn't care about their learning. She grades on a very specific rubric; the exams are based on her opinions and phrases, not international trade. She never goes over material that students have clearly struggled on, but expects you to figure out her rubric yourself. The worst professor I've had at UCSC.

THIS was the terrible teacher i ever meet in the UCSC. so rude...5 pages notes in one lecture, horrible grade policy.....basically i didn't learned anything from her. she just copy the notes from the book and lecturing.

Like a lot of these past reviews have said, she is very rude to students. She makes condescending remarks to even just a simple questions on certain things. Poole also has the most annoying ranging of pitches while she lecture. I never went to office hours but how can I when I see people get attacked in class for some simple stuff?

Extremely rude, unapproachable, and scornful of student questions.  Not helpful in office hours.  You will be constantly behind, and you will HAVE to go to all sections and TA office hours.  I generally like my econ teachers at UCSC but not Professor Poole.

Fast going teacher. Non-stop note taking class for almost 105mins. The TA is extremely mean, and sometimes she will give out incorrect answers. Attend every class will have no problem passing the class, but A it? uh...Work Hard!

This class was challenging and not exactly the most interesting UD elective. Jennifer comes across as kind of harsh but I appreciate the fact that her lectures are very clear and organized. If you are willing to put in the effort then she's there to help and ultimately I learned a lot from this class.

She is a great professor!!!! Her class is really easy and straight forward. Go to class (all of them) take good notes, and study hard!!!! I got my good share from doing all of this and got an A!!!!!!! Jennifer as a teacher could work on some people skills though hahaha, but she's there to help you all the way!!!!

Class was tough in the process. Definitely worked & studied the material until I knew it completely. Went to office hours & TA's office hours weekly. While taking the class, I hated it and could not wish to get out. Now that the quarter ended, it really wasn't that hard.  All my hard work paid off.  :)  Just STUDY.

Typical feel from a teacher who is more interested in research than teaching, I learned more from TA's than anything else. The teacher was very unapproachable and very hostile when students asked questions. The typical response to a person's question would be "you should already know that...review your notes from past classes, that should be easy"

This class is horrible! I would not recommend this to anyone, no one deserves this kind of pain in their lives.  Material is unreal and way too much to learn in one quarter.  She tests fairly but doesn't provide answer keys so you have to "seek out" answers and if you can't make office hours, you're screwed. I hated this class! I regret taking it!
